alert.note: Alert for Kings; Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 29 at 1:45PM EDT until September 29 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR KINGS (BROOKLYN) AND QUEENS COUNTIES... At 145 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rain was falling across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen, with a couple of locations receiving 7 inches of rain. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jamaica, Flatbush, Flushing, Coney Island, Rockaway Beach, Crown Heights, Kennedy Airport, Laguardia Airport, RFK Bridge, Jackson Heights, Forest Hills, Canarsie, Bay Ridge, Astoria, Bayside, Whitestone, Howard Beach, Ozone Park, Brooklyn Heights and Sheepshead Bay. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
